Tony Stark.Action: Offers his hand to Nebula after losing the game, showing good sportsmanship.
Addresses a personal, emotional message to Pepper Potts in a recording, showing sincerity and vulnerability.
Makes a dry, somewhat joking comment about Nebula being 'only a tiny bit sadistic,' showing a friendly, tolerant attitude toward her quirks.
Addresses Pep with honesty about their dire situation and his failed plan to surprise her.
Speaks to himself realistically but gently, admitting fear and vulnerability while expressing love ('I’m going to dream about you. It’s always you.')
Allows Nebula to honor his privacy when he is vulnerable and unwell.
Acknowledges failure to stop Thanos and expresses loss emotionally but remains present and engaged.
Despite physical weakness and emotional pain, participates in strategic discussions with team members about the crisis.
Admits they have no leads or strategies and offers no options, showing a moment of helplessness and lack of solutions.
Rips out his RT communicator and gives it to Rhodey with instructions to hide it, attempting to take some action despite feeling defeated.
Collapses from stress or weakness, requiring help from Rhodey and sedation.
Calls Morgan to lunch gently and takes off her helmet carefully, showing care and affection.
Engages in playful banter with Morgan Stark (daughter) demonstrating a warm, caring relationship.
Acknowledges the presence of friends and thanks them sincerely for coming, showing appreciation.
Skeptical and sarcastic about the time travel plan, calling it an 'exotic suicide method' and 'impossible', showing doubt but not necessarily hostility.
Takes his daughter Morgan into his arms and values his family time over the mission, declining to join others.
Invites Steve to stay for lunch and expresses happiness to see him despite refusal to join mission.
Firmly refuses Scott's plea to help with the mission, showing emotional distance and refusal to empathize.
Refuses to join the mission despite its importance, choosing to prioritize his family and current happiness over potential risks.
Politely but firmly shuts down Steve’s attempts to recruit him, showing clear boundary-setting and confidence in his decision.
Expresses affection to Morgan with 'Love you tons' and responds warmly to 'Love you three thousand.'
Sits beside Pepper Potts sharing in his dilemma and listening to her concerns.
Shares a sincere moment with Pepper about the difficulty of the situation and acknowledges their joint struggle.
Acknowledges he can't help everybody, showing a realistic and somewhat resigned attitude.
Mentions locking the lab and going to bed, suggesting a momentary withdrawal or avoidance.
Arrives promptly to help with time travel problem and fixes it, demonstrating responsibility and goodwill.
Acknowledges past resentment and expresses desire for peace, recognizing that resentment is corrosive.
Openly shares priorities including hoping to bring back lost people and desire to survive, showing sincere motivation.
Offers Steve his shield, symbolizing trust and reconciliation after years of conflict.
Diagnoses the flawed time travel method and explains the EPR paradox accurately.
Arrives confidently with a fully-functioning time-space GPS (the star-shaped capacitor), demonstrating advanced technical skill.
Mediates a tense moment with Steve Rogers, facilitating a productive alliance based on mutual respect and clear priorities.
Retrieves Steve's shield carefully to keep it safe from Morgan using it inappropriately.
Expresses emotional vulnerability briefly but quickly covers it with a confident gesture.
Jokes about team logistics and plans to get the whole team, showing confidence in his leadership and planning.
Thor hugs Smart Hulk and playfully confronts a gamer, inviting everyone to hang out with drinks.
Rocket and Smart Hulk stare silently at Thor's aggressive grab of Hulk's shirt before he gently removes his hand after being asked.
Not present or mentioned in this section; no direct display of competence or incompetence.
Blows past Thor confidently and jokes with Rocket, showing quick wit and confidence in the moment.
Thanks Rocket after Rocket fixes a mechanical problem, indicating awareness and appreciation of practical skills.
No demonstrated technical work or intellectual contribution in this excerpt; mostly social interactions and banter.
Approaches Clint after his time travel attempt and quickly assesses the situation, asking for good news.
Participates in the strategic planning with the team, showing engagement with complex concepts like the Infinity Stones and their artifacts.
Encourages Smart Hulk to begin mission with a light, friendly tone ('All right, you heard the man. Stroke those keys, Jolly Green.')
Confidently acknowledges the mission and encourages Smart Hulk to start the process, taking initiative during a critical moment.
Stands silently without proposing any additional plans or precautions despite the high stakes and uncertainty voiced by Steve.
Peers at the Avengers tableau from behind cover, makes a teasing comment to Cap about his outfit.
Engages in light banter and camaraderie with Steve and Scott, encouraging the team.
Uses his gauntleted hand to safely place the Tesseract into an aluminum attache case, indicating careful handling of an important artifact.
Confidently flicks Scott Lang into the attache case, demonstrating skill and control in a complex, coordinated action.
Makes a sarcastic remark about Hydra to Scott Lang, showing awareness but also a light tone rather than immediate alarm.
Leaps out the window with Bleeding Edge armor forming around him as he falls.
Circles around the building and counts enemies, communicates tactical updates over the comms confidently.
Waves to Steve from behind a crashed car, signaling a problem and engaging with teammates.
Responds defensively and with frustration to Scott Lang after a failed plan, unwilling to accept criticism calmly.
Attempts to focus on solutions and strategizes pragmatically about Loki and the Time Heist despite tension.
Proposes a risky but hopeful plan to retrieve the Tesseract and save everyone.
Asks Steve if he trusts him before undertaking the dangerous mission.
Proposes a novel, risky plan to re-take the Tesseract and acquire new particles, demonstrating creative problem-solving and confidence.
Admits uncertainty by describing his knowledge of the time/location as 'vaguely exact', showing realistic self-assessment rather than overconfidence.
Seeks and gains Steve's trust to proceed with the high-stakes plan despite inherent risks, reflecting leadership and confidence in his own capabilities.
Uses x-ray vision in his glasses to locate twenty floors of secret underground base beneath Camp Lehigh.
Successfully hacks open a high tech safe with nanotech gauntlet to retrieve the Tesseract.
Engages in confident, clever dialogue showing situational awareness and technical skill.
Offers a polite handshake to his father Howard Stark despite being overwhelmed
Generates a fake badge and lies about his identity to avoid suspicion
Accepts Howard Stark’s offer for some air without complaint
Distractedly walks away leaving the briefcase behind
Generates a nano-tech badge on the spot to cover his identity and attempts to bluff his way by pretending to be from MIT.
Distractedly walks away leaving the briefcase behind when questioned by Howard Stark.
Shares a sincere and vulnerable conversation with his father about his fears and uncertainties regarding fatherhood.
Expresses appreciation for his father's efforts and advice, showing emotional openness.
Smiles warmly at Jarvis, indicating friendly and respectful regard.
Encourages Howard Stark with supportive words 'You're going to do fine,' conveying kindness and reassurance.
Acknowledges his nervousness and lack of complete knowledge about fatherhood but demonstrates a willingness to learn and adapt by piecing things together as he goes along.
Offers thoughtful advice and encouragement to Howard Stark, signaling confidence and emotional intelligence.
Reflects positively on his father's practical wisdom, showing respect for expertise and experience.
Remains composed and warm during interaction, indicating social competence and confidence in a personal setting.
Calmly asks if Natasha had family, showing emotional awareness and measured response amid grief.
Engages in serious discussion about the situation logically instead of immediately resorting to magical or unrealistic solutions.
Does not overreact or jump to unrealistic conclusions after the snap reversal, showing measured judgment.
Carefully operates robotic arms to assemble the Iron Man gauntlet holding the Infinity Stones.
Questions Thor's impulsive attempt to take the gauntlet without group consensus.

Operates the robotic arms to carefully place the Power Stone into a new Iron Man gauntlet using nano-tech, fine tuning the glove with Rocket and Smart Hulk; demonstrates advanced technical skill and leadership in preparing the key device.
Interrupts Thor abruptly when he reaches to wear the gauntlet before a decision is made, showing some impatience or poor group coordination.
Approaches Thanos warily alongside Steve and Thor, ready to fight together.
Wraps his arms around Peter Parker, smashing Peter’s face into his chest plate in a warm embrace.
Flies overhead searching upward and uses his HUD and AI (Friday) to analyze an incoming threat in the form of a comet heading straight for Earth.
Lunges to take the Infinity Gauntlet from Thanos to protect others, despite the excruciating pain.
Uses the Infinity Stones to snap away Thanos and his army, saving countless lives.
Demonstrates self-sacrifice by enduring great suffering to achieve victory.
In the face of inevitable defeat, creates a new Infinity Gauntlet using nano-particles, demonstrating technological genius and quick thinking.
Takes the decisive action to snap his fingers and defeat Thanos, showing confidence and resolve despite excruciating pain.
Comforts Peter Parker in his final moments, allowing him to hold his hand.
Shows vulnerability and sorrow in the presence of Pepper Potts, letting her comfort him.
Successfully executes the final act leading to victory, sacrificing himself in the process.
Accepts his fate with calmness and lets go when dying, showing emotional strength in final moments.
Expresses hope for families to be reunited and for a normal version of the planet to be restored.
Acknowledges the difficult reality that children have to grow up in a world shaped by epic forces of light and dark.
Records a holographic message acknowledging the possibility of his own death, addressing loved ones with sincerity and care.
Records a hologram message preparing for possible death during a high-risk time-travel mission, showing foresight and acceptance of consequences.
Expresses uncertainty about the survivability of the time travel plan but commits to the mission regardless.
Reflects on the complexity and epic scale of the universe and the stakes involved with some humility.
Expresses sorrow and admits 'I couldn't stop him' and 'I lost the kid.'
Reassures Pepper Potts by saying 'I’m not going anywhere' when she throws herself into his arms.
Expresses blunt skepticism about fighting Thanos and shows emotional vulnerability about past failures.
Dismisses Steve's request for focus and says 'I needed you, as in past tense.', cutting off support.
Shows sarcastic humor ('I need a shave and a burger, not a bowl of soup') to lighten a tense moment.
Appears disengaged and emotionally withdrawn, barely acknowledging Steve's concerns.
Admits defeat openly and gives Rhodey his suit to protect and continue the mission despite having no clues or strategies.
Shows vulnerability by collapsing and allowing others to care for him.
Expresses no trust toward Captain America during an emotionally charged moment.
Remains silent and does not take initiative during critical planning moments.
Does the dishes, showing willingness to perform unglamorous tasks while others discuss big plans.
Gives Steve his shield back, chokes up, and jokingly talks about the team.
Teases Rocket about his name and hands in a lighthearted manner.
Thanks Rocket after he fixes the hatch.
Clarifies and corrects Steve's statement about Infinity Stones, showing knowledge and attention to detail.
Acknowledges the difficulty of their mission by stating 'Our history. Not all of them are going to be a fun drop-in.', demonstrating realistic assessment and strategic thinking.
Engages in detailed discussion about the Time Stone and its location, correctly identifying cross streets Sullivan and Bleecker in New York, showing sharp knowledge and analytical thinking.
Collaborates effectively with Natasha and Smart Hulk to piece together complex time travel logistics, showing teamwork and problem-solving skills.
Organizes the team by directing them to huddle and remove their suits before proceeding with the mission.
Arrives on time with the team, showing punctuality and readiness for the mission.
Warns others to be careful with Loki’s scepter, showing concern for their safety.
Jokes by saying 'You're small but you’re talking loud' to Scott Lang.
Playfully flicks Scott Lang, preparing him to enter the attache case.
Carries the Tesseract case, leads group through lobby, responds to teammates with light humor about axe body spray.
Uses casual nickname 'Thumbelina' over com, asks team to focus during mission.
Commands Scott Lang over com during a risky procedure, maintaining communication and calm.
Takes immediate action to retrieve the Tesseract case in a dangerous situation, showing responsibility.
Engages in assertive jurisdictional argument with Alexander Pierce to protect his property.
Asserts jurisdiction over the property confidently by stating 'That is my name on the glass,' showing awareness and control of the situation.
Calmly instructs Scott Lang during a risky medical procedure while under pressure, showing presence of mind and technical knowledge.
Recognizes the urgency when Alexander Pierce reaches for the case and warns Scott to 'pull my plug,' indicating strategic thinking and self-sacrifice to protect the case.
Recovers possession of the Tesseract case after it spins across the floor, demonstrating physical agility and quick reflexes.
Passes the stairwell door unaware of Hulk’s sudden attack, resulting in Hulk smashing Tony in the face and tumbling him.
Successfully catches an object spinning across the floor into his hand.
Walks toward a side door and communicates proactively over com with others.
Waves to Steve from behind a crashed car and alerts the team that there is a problem, showing situational awareness and leadership.
Admits getting hit in the head with a Hulk, explaining why things went wrong, showing self-awareness and accountability.
Tries to analyze the situation by suggesting that Loki might be at home in Asgard and proposing a plan to find him, showing strategic thinking.
Gets defensive and frustrated when Scott criticizes him for ruining the Time Heist, showing emotional reactivity that may undermine competence.
Appears to be struggling internally as Steve and Scott argue, his mind whirling, possibly indicating momentary uncertainty or pressure.
Smiles playfully at the Tesseract and makes a joking remark about it being a future 'pain-in-the-ass.'
Asks if Nat had family, showing concern for her background and connection.
Engages in a somber conversation acknowledging loss and grief with others.
Asks questions that may seem straightforward but are sincere attempts to process grief.
Interrupts Thor to caution him about the danger of using the gauntlet, showing concern for others' safety.
Armors up and nanos a shield to protect Clint beside him during preparation, demonstrating protective and caring behavior.
Armors up and nanos a shield to protect Clint beside him.
Urgently checks on Smart Hulk and tells others not to move him.
Wakes Steve and shares a light, slightly teasing comment about losing the shield.
Calmly reports his reading of life signs and informs Steve about the situation.
Deploys armor and shows readiness to confront threat despite risks.
Sends an overload blast at Thanos after Thor's lightning strike, showing tactical coordination and quick reaction.
Gets grabbed by Thanos and used as a shield against an attack, then goes tumbling out cold, indicating vulnerability and momentary defeat.
HUD (Friday) attempts to revive him promptly after being knocked out, showing reliance on advanced tech and preparedness.
Seeks confirmation from Dr. Strange about the plan's odds and chooses to trust his judgment despite uncertainty.
Rockets away confidently after receiving ambiguous reassurance, demonstrating self-assurance and decisiveness.
Says 'I love you 3000' to Morgan in a heartfelt farewell.
Prepares a video message expressing love and reassurance to his family and team before his ultimate sacrifice.
